Computer
Laboratory

Laboratory

Each laboratory room is described
as follows:
The computer laboratory is
located in the 2nd Floor of Teofilo
G. Grepo Building. It is utilized to
enhance classroom curriculum
through the integration of
technology during laboratory
classes and to give each student
the opportunity to enhance their
understanding in using computer
and software programs that are
appropriate for their professional
development.

Each laboratory room is described
as follows:
The stenography laboratory is
located in the 2nd Floor of Second
Floor of Martina S. Ferrer Building.
The primary purpose of the
laboratory is to provide an
appropriate setting for students to
learn and practice proper
transcribing and recording
proceeding and events through
shorthand and steno machine
suitable for their professional
development.

use are listed as follows:

PARAMETER A LABORATORIES , SHOPS, AND FACILITIES
BEST PRACTICES
The laboratories serve as an avenue
to the development of students’
skills which is vital for their profession.
In order for it to perform its functions,
the laboratory users abide to
sufficient practices in order to
maintain its quality and to provide
students a well-pleasing work area.
At the beginning of the semester,
the students were oriented with the
guidelines they should abide while
working in the laboratory.

The students were oriented with
the location and use of the first-aid
kits, fire extinguishers and other
safety devices available in the
laboratory.
Precautionary measures are
discussed before the proper
laboratory sessions.
The use of various laboratory tools
and equipment were
demonstrated by the laboratory
technician and the faculty among
the students.

In order to maintain cleanliness in
the laboratories, the students were
tasked to weep the floor before
and after the class.
The lights, fans and other
equipment were strictly
monitored/turned off right after
the class to minimize the use of
electricity with exception to some
equipment placed within
laboratory premises which are
under use.

Electrical supply is always available
among laboratory rooms. The
students are encouraged to
maximize the use of these supplies
by preparing framework or flow of
work during the conduction.
Every day, before and after classes,
the utility personnel clean the
laboratory rooms and maintain the
arrangements of chairs and tables
and other furniture in the laboratory.
The number of chairs in the
laboratory rooms was minimized to
allow mobility while working.

The utilization of the laboratory
rooms was bounded to a limited
number of students each room to
maximize the capacity of the
laboratory.
In using the laboratories during
periods beyond class hours, a
request letter approved by the
campus administrator of the
requesting party should be
addressed to the laboratory
technician and the department
chair beforehand

PARAMETER B. EQUIPMENT, SUPPLIES & MATERIALS
BEST PRACTICES

Equipment, supplies and materials
are the most vital necessities in
order to work in the laboratory. The
quality of the equipment and
availability of the supplies and
materials should be maintained in
order to obtain valuable and
promising results from the
experiments. The equipment,
supplies and materials in the
laboratory are maintained through
the following practices:

Every beginning of the semester,
the students were introduced with the
basic uses and functions of various
tools and equipment. Hands-on
training and practical exams are also
conducted during laboratory sessions
under the supervision of the faculty.
Each laboratory equipment has its
own log sheet which registers the
name of the user, time and date of
usage, supervising personnel and the
user’s signature. It allows monitoring of
the use of the equipment,
troubleshooting of the possible
occurring problems and tracing of the
person responsible for the possible
occurring problems.

The number and availability
laboratory supplies, equipment and
materials are frequently subjected
to inventory for estimating the
specific number of pieces needed
for purchase request.
The faculty always coordinate with
the laboratory technician to
monitor the materials necessary for
the upcoming conductions of
experiments.

A stock of accessories for certain
laboratory equipment is available
under the supervision of the
laboratory technician.
Demonstrations of different brands
of laboratory equipment from
different suppliers are always
conducted within the laboratory
premises. This allows the laboratory
management to canvass laboratory
equipment with the better quality
and suits the budget allotted.

PARAMETER C. MAINTENANCE
IMPLEMENTATION
The maintenance system of the
laboratories and equipment is
described briefly as follows:

Computer Laboratory
Schedule of general cleaning and
maintenance of all computers in
computer laboratory was
conducted every semestral break
specifically two weeks after the final
examination.
Stenography Laboratory
Schedule of general cleaning and
maintenance of all stenography
machines in the laboratory was
conducted every semestral break
specifically two weeks after the final
examination.

Safety devices are available.

Cleaning & Maintenance of
Computer Laboratory

Cleaning & Maintenance of
Stenography Laboratory

PARAMETER C. MAINTENANCE
BEST PRACTICES
The laboratory technician maintains
the orderliness of laboratories and
the quality of the equipment.

Visual monitoring is always
conducted to find and replace the
tools especially the glassware that
are no longer sufficient for use.
The laboratory technician always
performs troubleshooting when the
equipment malfunctions. A test run
is conducted when the equipment
will be used.

Tools and equipment that have
been damaged due to students’
negligence will be recorded in the
laboratory technician’s log book
and the student should
immediately replace or
compensate the damaged cause.
If the damage on tools and
equipment were caused by
accident, the students will not be
held liable. The laboratory
technician will report the damage
to the immediate supervisor.

The laboratory management
requests from the suppliers and
other external institution for the
periodic calibration and cleaning of
high-end laboratory equipment and
tools.
Electrical maintenance, roof and
window repair, installation of
equipment, water supply
maintenance and other repair
services are rendered by the
Physical Plant Services office of the
University.

The cleanliness of the laboratory
rooms is maintained by the utility
personnel every day.
The students were tasked for
maintaining the cleanliness of their
working area during their classes.
Waste segregation is observed
within the facilities of the
department. Labeled trash bins
are used for disposal of solid
wastes.

Stenography Laboratory PARAMETER D. SPECIAL PROVISIONS
BEST PRACTICES

The laboratory technician frequently
inventories the available materials
and tools in the supply room.
The laboratory technician prepares
purchase request for materials
needed to be replaced or
replenished.
Demonstrations of different brands of
laboratory equipment from different
suppliers are always conducted with
in the laboratory premises. This
allows the laboratory management
to canvass laboratory equipment
with the better quality and suits the
budget allotted.

The canvassed equipment was
included in the PPMP and APP.
In using the laboratories during
periods beyond class hours, a
request letter approved by the
campus administrator of the
requesting party should be
addressed to the laboratory
technician and the department
chair beforehand.

Each laboratory equipment has its
own log sheet which registers the
name of the user, time and date of
usage, supervising personnel and
the user’s signature. It allows
monitoring of the use of the
equipment, troubleshooting of the
possible occurring problems and
tracing of the person responsible for
the possible occurring problems.
